workout_programs.name: Baixos Foundation Training - Gym Session 1
workout_programs.description: Maximum strength and isometric endurance training for castellers in the baix position. Focus on leg strength, core stability, and grip endurance.

exercises.name: Leg Swings
exercises.notes: Forward/back and side-to-side

exercises.name: Back Squats
exercises.notes: Focus on depth and control. 3 seconds down, 1 second pause at bottom, 1 second up. This builds maximum leg strength for supporting weight of tower.
exercises.progression: Increase weight by 2.5-5kg when all sets completed with good form

exercises.name: Isometric Wall Sits
exercises.notes: Hold squat position with back against wall. Thighs parallel to ground. Essential for building hold endurance needed during castell construction.
exercises.progression: Add weight plate on thighs or increase duration by 5-10 seconds

exercises.name: Romanian Deadlifts
exercises.notes: Focus on hip hinge pattern. Keep back neutral. Strengthens posterior chain for stability.

exercises.name: Barbell Shrugs
exercises.notes: Shoulder elevation strength for supporting weight on shoulders during castell.

exercises.name: Front Plank
exercises.notes: Maintain rigid torso position. Core stability prevents spinal flexion under load.

exercises.name: Dead Hangs
exercises.notes: Grip endurance essential for extended holds. Decompress spine.
exercises.progression: Increase hold duration by 5 seconds when completing all sets

workout_programs.name: Baixos Foundation Training - Gym Session 2
workout_programs.description: Power and stability training for baix position. Focus on explosive strength and unilateral work.

exercises.name: Hip Circles
exercises.notes: Each direction

exercises.name: Goblet Squats
exercises.notes: Hold dumbbell or kettlebell at chest. Front-loaded position mimics castell loading pattern.

exercises.name: Bulgarian Split Squats
exercises.notes: Rear foot elevated. Unilateral strength and balance for asymmetric loading.

exercises.name: Farmer's Walks
exercises.notes: Heavy dumbbells or kettlebells. Total body stability and grip endurance under load. Keep shoulders back and core tight.

exercises.name: Single-Leg Romanian Deadlifts
exercises.notes: Balance and posterior chain. Focus on hip hinge with controlled movement.

exercises.name: Pallof Press
exercises.notes: Anti-rotation core strength. Resist cable pulling you sideways.

exercises.name: Wrist Curls & Reverse Wrist Curls
exercises.notes: Grip and forearm strength. Do both flexion (palms up) and extension (palms down).

workout_programs.name: Baixos Foundation Training - Bodyweight Session 1
workout_programs.description: Bodyweight leg strength and isometric endurance for baix position. No equipment needed - perfect for outdoor training or home workouts.

exercises.name: Bodyweight Squats
exercises.notes: High volume for muscular endurance. Progression: Add 3-second pause at bottom.

exercises.name: Wall Sits
exercises.notes: Essential isometric hold training. Back against wall, thighs parallel to ground.

exercises.name: Reverse Lunges (Alternating)
exercises.notes: Controlled tempo. Step back, drop knee toward ground, push through front heel to return.

exercises.name: Single-Leg Glute Bridges
exercises.notes: Lie on back, one foot on ground, other leg extended. Lift hips by squeezing glutes.

exercises.name: Plank Series
exercises.notes: Complete all three planks before resting. Maintain rigid body position.

exercises.name: Pull-up Bar Hangs
exercises.notes: If no pull-up bar available, substitute with towel wringing or hand grippers.

workout_programs.name: Contrafort Support Training - Gym Session 1
workout_programs.description: Upper body pushing strength and anti-extension core for contrafort position. Focus on bracing strength and grip endurance.

exercises.name: Bench Press
exercises.notes: Horizontal pushing strength. Retract shoulder blades, controlled descent.

exercises.name: Overhead Press
exercises.notes: Vertical pushing strength. Brace core to prevent back extension.

exercises.name: Cable Chest Press Holds (Isometric)
exercises.notes: Press cables to mid-extension and hold. Simulates sustained bracing against castell.

exercises.name: Dead Bugs
exercises.notes: Anti-extension core work. Press lower back into floor. Prevent spinal extension.

exercises.name: Farmer's Walks
exercises.notes: Grip endurance and postural strength. Keep chest up, shoulders back.

exercises.name: Face Pulls
exercises.notes: Shoulder health and posterior chain. Pull rope to face level, externally rotate.

workout_programs.name: Primeres Mans Overhead Training - Gym Session 1
workout_programs.description: Overhead pressing strength and shoulder stability for primeres mans position. Supporting segons requires strong, stable shoulders.

exercises.name: Overhead Press
exercises.notes: Primary shoulder strength. Press bar from shoulders to lockout overhead. No leg drive.

exercises.name: Landmine Press
exercises.notes: Angle-specific pressing. Mimics upward pressing angle of supporting segons.

exercises.name: Lateral Raises
exercises.notes: Side deltoid development for shoulder width and strength.

exercises.name: Face Pulls
exercises.notes: Shoulder health and posterior chain balance. Critical for injury prevention.

exercises.name: Overhead Carries
exercises.notes: Stability under load. Walk with weight(s) locked out overhead. Maintain vertical alignment.

exercises.name: Dead Hangs
exercises.notes: Grip endurance for holding legs/ankles of segons during long holds.

workout_programs.name: Segons Tower Climber Training - Gym Session 1
workout_programs.description: Climbing strength, balance, and grip training for segons and tower positions. Combines upper body pulling with lower body balance work.

exercises.name: Pull-ups
exercises.notes: Upper body pulling for climbing. If unable to complete reps, use lat pulldown.

exercises.name: Bulgarian Split Squats
exercises.notes: Single-leg strength for climbing and balancing on shoulders.

exercises.name: Cable Woodchops
exercises.notes: Rotational core strength for climbing and stabilizing.

exercises.name: Single-Leg Romanian Deadlifts
exercises.notes: Balance and posterior chain. Essential for standing on unstable shoulders.

exercises.name: Hanging Knee Raises
exercises.notes: Core strength and grip endurance combined. Hanging from bar simulates climbing.

exercises.name: Box Step-ups with Knee Drive
exercises.notes: Simulates climbing motion. Step up with power, drive opposite knee up.

workout_programs.name: Pom de Dalt Balance & Control - Bodyweight Session
workout_programs.description: Balance, core control, and bodyweight strength for upper tower positions (Dosos, Aixecador, Enxaneta). Focus on proprioception and stability.

exercises.name: Bodyweight Squats (Controlled Tempo)
exercises.notes: Perfect form and control. 3-second descent, 1-second pause, 1-second ascent.

exercises.name: Single-Leg Balance Holds
exercises.notes: Stand on one leg, maintain balance. Progress to eyes closed.

exercises.name: V-Sits
exercises.notes: Sit on ground, lift legs and torso to create V-shape. Hold position.

exercises.name: Crab Walks
exercises.notes: Reverse tabletop position. Walk forward and backward. Shoulder stability.

exercises.name: Hollow Body Rocks
exercises.notes: Core control and stability. Press lower back into ground, rock slightly.

exercises.name: Tree Pose (Yoga Balance)
exercises.notes: Stand on one leg, other foot on inner thigh. Arms overhead. Focus and balance.

exercise_library.name: Back Squat
instructions: Position barbell on upper back across trapezius muscles
Feet shoulder-width apart, toes slightly out
Brace core, chest up, eyes forward
Descend by pushing hips back and bending knees
Lower until thighs parallel to ground or below
Drive through heels to stand, maintaining upright torso
Full hip and knee extension at top
exercise_library.castell_relevance: Essential for baixos - builds maximal leg strength to support tower weight

exercise_library.name: Isometric Wall Sit
instructions: Stand with back against wall
Slide down until thighs parallel to ground
Knees at 90-degree angle, directly above ankles
Back flat against wall, core engaged
Hold position for prescribed duration
Breathe steadily throughout hold
common_mistakes: Allowing back to arch away from wall
exercise_library.castell_relevance: Directly mimics baixos holding position during castell construction - critical isometric endurance

exercise_library.name: Overhead Press (Military Press)
instructions: Start with barbell at shoulder height, hands slightly wider than shoulders
Feet hip-width apart, core braced
Press bar straight up, keeping elbows slightly in front of bar
Lockout arms overhead, shrug shoulders up at top
Lower bar with control back to shoulders
No leg drive - strict press only
common_mistakes: Using leg drive (making it a push press)
Pressing bar forward instead of straight up
exercise_library.castell_relevance: Primary exercise for primeres mans - overhead strength to support segons' weight

exercise_library.name: Dead Hang
instructions: Grasp pull-up bar with overhand grip
Hands shoulder-width apart
Hang with arms fully extended
Engage shoulders slightly - don't completely relax
Keep core tight, legs together or crossed
Hold for prescribed duration
Breathe steadily
exercise_library.castell_relevance: Grip endurance essential for all positions - extended holds during castell construction

exercise_library.name: Farmer's Walk
instructions: Stand between two heavy dumbbells/kettlebells
Squat down, grasp handles
Stand up straight, weights at sides
Shoulders back, chest up, core engaged
Walk forward with controlled steps
Maintain upright posture throughout
Don't allow weights to pull you sideways
exercise_library.castell_relevance: Total body stability and grip endurance under load - mimics sustained holds in castell

exercise_library.name: Bulgarian Split Squat
instructions: Stand facing away from bench, 2-3 feet in front
Place top of rear foot on bench behind you
Hold dumbbells at sides (if using weight)
Lower body by bending front knee until thigh parallel to ground
Keep front knee aligned with toes, don't let it cave inward
Press through front heel to return to starting position
Complete all reps on one leg before switching
common_mistakes: Rear foot placement too far back (excessive hip flexor stretch)
exercise_library.castell_relevance: Unilateral leg strength and balance crucial for climbing positions and asymmetric loading

exercise_library.name: Dead Bug
instructions: Lie on back, arms extended straight up toward ceiling
Lift legs so knees bent at 90 degrees, shins parallel to ground
Press lower back into floor - this is critical
Slowly lower right arm overhead and extend left leg
Keep lower back pressed into floor throughout
Return to starting position, alternate sides
Move slowly and with control
common_mistakes: Lower back arching off floor (the most common error)
Not achieving full extension of limbs
exercise_library.castell_relevance: Anti-extension core strength prevents spinal flexion under load - critical for all positions

exercise_library.name: Pallof Press
instructions: Set cable at chest height
Stand sideways to machine, feet shoulder-width apart
Grasp handle with both hands at chest
Step away from machine to create tension
Press hands straight out from chest
Resist cable trying to rotate you toward machine
Hold extension for 2-3 seconds, return to chest
Complete all reps, then switch sides
common_mistakes: Allowing torso to rotate toward cable
Not stepping far enough from machine (insufficient tension)
Pressing up or down instead of straight out
exercise_library.castell_relevance: Anti-rotation strength for maintaining position under asymmetric loads in pinya

exercise_library.name: Cable Woodchop
instructions: Set cable at high position
Stand sideways to machine, feet wider than shoulder-width
Grasp handle with both hands
Rotate torso and pull cable down and across body toward opposite hip
Pivot back foot, rotate through core
Control return to starting position
Complete all reps, switch sides for low-to-high variation
common_mistakes: Using arms instead of core rotation
exercise_library.castell_relevance: Rotational core strength for climbing and dynamic movements in tower positions

exercise_library.name: Hanging Knee Raises
instructions: Hang from pull-up bar with overhand grip
Engage shoulders slightly (don't dead hang completely relaxed)
Bend knees and raise them toward chest
Lift knees as high as possible, ideally to chest level
Control descent back to starting position
Avoid swinging or using momentum
exercise_library.castell_relevance: Core strength combined with grip endurance - essential for climbers

program_notes.frequency: Train 2-3 times per week with at least 48 hours between sessions targeting the same muscle groups
program_notes.progression: Increase weight by 2.5-5% when all prescribed reps/sets completed with good form. For isometric holds, increase duration by 5-10 seconds.
program_notes.nutrition: Aim for 1.6-2.2g protein per kg bodyweight daily. Stay well hydrated with 3-4 liters water per day.
program_notes.recovery: Prioritize 7-9 hours sleep nightly. Include stretching and foam rolling after workouts.
program_notes.customization: Choose gym or bodyweight versions based on available equipment and training location. Both are equally effective when performed consistently.
program_notes.periodization: Follow 8-week training blocks: Weeks 1-2 adaptation, Weeks 3-5 strength building, Weeks 6-7 peak strength, Week 8 deload (reduce volume 40-50%).
